sen.j: 護良親王の側近として常にその活動に随従し、令旨の奉者に度々なっている。
sen.e: As an aide of Imperial Prince Moriyoshi, Takasada always accompanied the prince and often served as the transmitter of the prince's "Ryoji" (the official command document directly from the Imperial Family members).
sen.cmt: ①「令旨」の解説では「皇族から直接発せられる、その命令を書き記した公文書」（集英社・国語辞典参照）と訳しています。 ②「奉者」は「（令旨を）献呈する人（dedicant)」ではなく「（令旨を）承る人（つまり、これを受け他者に伝達する人）」と解して訳しています。

sen.j: 1333年（元弘3年/正慶2年）1月19日 (旧暦)の天王寺の戦いでは「大将軍」として楠木氏の軍勢などを率いて幕府軍と戦った（『楠木合戦注文』）。
sen.e: On January 19, 1333 (by the lunar calendar), in the Battle of Tenno-ji, Takasada led the military force (including that of the Kusunoki clan) as "Dai Shogun" (the great general) and fought with the army of the Kamakura shogunate. [cf. "Kusunoki Kassenchumon"]

sen.j: 建武の新政が始まると6月13日 (旧暦)、父の隆資とともに兵を率いて入京した（『太平記』）が、護良親王が失脚して鎌倉に押送されると、その余党を取り除こうとした建武政権の手により1334年（建武 (日本)元年）12月に殺害された。
sen.e: When "Kenmu no shinsei" (the new regime in Kenmu era by Emperor Godaigo) began on June 13 (by the lunar calendar), Takasada led the army with his father Takasuke into Kyoto (cf. "Taiheiki"), however, Imperial Prince Moriyoshi was ousted and was sent to Kamakura as a criminal, so Takasada was killed in December of 1334 by the Kenmu regime which intended to remove the remnants of the group related to the prince.
sen.cmt: ※「押送」とは「罪人として護送されること」なので、左でもそう訳しています。
sen.e: When "Kenmu no shinsei" (the new regime in Kenmu era by Emperor Godaigo) began on June 13 (by the lunar calendar), Takasada led the army with his father Takasuke into Kyoto (cf. "Taiheiki"), however, Imperial Prince Moriyoshi was ousted and was sent to Kamakura as a criminal, so Takasada was killed in December of 1334 by the Kenmu regime which intended to remove the remnants of the group related to the prince.

When Kenmu Restoration began, Takasada led the army with his father Takasuke into Kyoto on August 2 ("Taiheiki" (The Record of the Great Peace)), however, Imperial Prince Morinaga was ousted and was sent to Kamakura as a criminal, so Takasada was killed in January 1335 (December 1334 in old calendar) by the Kenmu regime which intended to remove the remnants of the group related to the imperial prince.
